title: 110_hr1459
content: Extended phase-in of the inpatient rehabilitation facility classification criteria. The Deficit Reduction Act of 2005 is amended to require a compliance rate no greater than 60 percent for cost reporting periods starting on or after July 1, 2006. Patients with comorbidities are included in the inpatient population for cost reporting periods starting on or after July 1, 2008. Rehabilitation Hospitals and Units must adhere to HCFA Ruling 85-2 to determine medical necessity for services provided to Medicare beneficiaries under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. SEC. 2. Recommendations for classifying inpatient rehabilitation hospitals and units. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will submit a report to Congress within 12 months of the Act's enactment. The report will examine the impact of the 75 percent rule on Medicare and beneficiaries, and propose alternatives for determining exclusion criteria for inpatient rehabilitation hospitals under Medicare. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will submit a report to Congress within 12 months of the Act's enactment, examining the impact of the 75 percent rule on Medicare beneficiaries. The report will also propose alternative criteria for determining exclusion criteria for inpatient rehabilitation hospitals under Medicare, focusing on access to care and effectiveness in other healthcare settings. The report to Congress will analyze the effects of the 75 percent rule on Medicare beneficiaries, comparing costs and outcomes in different healthcare settings. It will also suggest alternative criteria for inpatient rehabilitation hospitals under Medicare. The report will analyze the impact of the 75 percent rule on Medicare beneficiaries, focusing on extended lengths of stay in post-acute settings due to denied access to care in rehabilitation hospitals. Technical correction for inpatient rehabilitation hospitals and units nomenclature. Technical correction for inpatient rehabilitation hospitals and units nomenclature. Section 1886(j) of the Social Security Act is amended to replace references to "rehabilitation facilities" with "inpatient rehabilitation hospitals or rehabilitation units" throughout. The term "IRH/U" must be used by the Secretary of Health and Human Services to refer to entities receiving payment for inpatient rehabilitation services under the Medicare program. The effective date for different sections of the Act is specified: Sections 1 and 3 will take effect on July 1, 2007, while section 2 will take effect on the date of the enactment of the Act.
